result.execSummary:
Mark Edward Larson Jr. was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Mark Edward Larson Jr. was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Edward Larson Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed by HWC and Defendant this date. eif

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John Kucinski,   DF:  Mark Edward Larson appeared from jail.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Includes 14CF475 & 14TR746 (Payment Hearing).  Court called at 1:03 p.m.  *QUASH WARRANT* on 14TR746.  Court orders the DE to meet with the payment clerk on 14TR746.  Attorney Kucinski would like dismissal for defective complaint.  State has a valid Apprehension Warrant out of the state of Minnesota for the DE.  DE wants to waive extradition.  Court signs extradition.  Court adjourned at 1:14  p.m. lw
